documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-07-01 ---

Routine protocol visit 1. Patient ID: SA-P006.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 148/94, heart rate 68, weight 87.8 kg.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 4.35 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 16.27 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 1.65 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 13.5 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 4.86 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.92 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-22 ---

SA-P006 — Cycle 2, Day 1 visit.

On exam, BP is 122/86, pulse 87, wt 82.3 kg. Patient appears slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 4.99 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 13.55 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 4.57 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 14.01 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 3.99 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.85 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

PSA now 9.97 ng/mL — decrease 6.8% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 3 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-08-12 ---

Follow-up visit #3 for patient SA-P006.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 120/77, heart rate 88, weight 85.3 kg.

Patient reports moderate diarrhea beginning day 63. Currently ongoing. Study drug dose was reduced per protocol guidelines.
moderate neutropenia detected. CTCAE Grade 2, onset day 62. Resolved by day 80. Patient monitored closely. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 3.92 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 17.67 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 3.7 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 13.1 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 4.4 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.95 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Monitor closely and reassess at next visit. Return for cycle 4 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-09-02 ---

Patient SA-P006 presents for scheduled cycle 4 visit.

VS: 105/94 | HR 77 | Wt 75.6 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 3.24 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 17.92 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 4.42 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 12.91 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 3.68 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.97 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (39.4% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

PSA level is 6.48 ng/mL (decrease 39.4% from baseline).

Plan: Monitor closely and reassess at next visit. Return for cycle 5 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-09-23 ---

Follow-up visit #5 for patient SA-P006.

VS: 125/92 | HR 75 | Wt 65.2 kg. Patient well-nourished and in no acute distress.

Patient reports Thrombocytopenia (moderate, Grade 2). First noted day 88. Currently ongoing. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 3.86 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 19.55 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 6.36 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 13.07 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 3.47 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.95 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-14 ---

Patient SA-P006 presents for scheduled cycle 6 visit.

VS: 131/91 | HR 67 | Wt 82.3 kg. Patient comfortable, no distress noted.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 2.88 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 19.23 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 5.91 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 12.91 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 2.81 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.98 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

PSA now 10.23 ng/mL — decrease 4.4% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 7 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-11-04 ---

SA-P006 — Cycle 7, Day 1 visit.

On exam, BP is 138/74, pulse 63, wt 96.1 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Adverse event noted: Headache — mild (CTCAE Grade 1). Onset day 127. Currently ongoing. Assessed as probable to study drug. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 3.14 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 19.09 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 5.97 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 12.69 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 3.02 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.98 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-25 ---

Patient SA-P006 presents for scheduled cycle 8 visit.

Vitals: BP 117/88 mmHg, HR 62 bpm, Weight 74.0 kg.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 2.34 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 20.68 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 7.46 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0] (LOW)
  - Hemoglobin: 12.84 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 2.73 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.01 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging assessment: Target lesion decreased from baseline — measured reduction of approximately 25.2%. Partial response per RECIST 1.1 criteria.

PSA now 8.0 ng/mL — decrease 25.2% from initial value.

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 9 in 3 weeks.
